author: J14T14
title: Who Ever Designed This Set Needs A Promotion!
review:
LEGO Minecraft has been around for a while, but this is the first polybag that we have gotten, and boy oh boy did they nail it! Most polybags hve a small build and maybe one minifigure. This set includes a small play scene and two minifigures! I can not recall any other polybag that includes this!

The build includes a sandy and grassy area with a small rock build. There is a build for a TNT block which includes two 1x2 printed bricks. When you push down on a 2x4 tile, the rock "exploads" and the small build launches off. This goes well with the creeper minifigure included. there is also a small plant build and torch build included.

The two minifigures are iconic to Minecraft as a whole and were perfect to include in this set. Steve is just in his standard attire and has a minecraft sward included as an accessory. The Creeper is also just standard and there is nothing special about it.

Overall, this is a perfect polybag for the Minecraft theme ans I hope that LEGO makes more of them. If you really want to, you could buy many copies of this set to build up an army af creepers and Steves. I recommend this set to anyone who wants a taste of the Minecraft theme or want to just have nice small build to add to their collection.

author: EpicMindvolt
title: One of the best polybags out there!
review:
Box/Instructions:

Plain and simple; gets the job done. Polybag and postcard-like instructions is all you need for a set this size.

Parts:

Simple pieces. Love the printed TNT bricks, and the inclusion of two large plates for such a small set. The rest of the pieces are common, but useful. If I could afford it, I'd buy a hundred of these just for the parts!

Minifigures:

It has two: a classic Steve and Creeper. This is great. A very cheap way to obtain two of the most iconic figured from Minecraft. That's honestly why I bought it. The only other Minecraft sets I had only had armored Steve or Alex, and the super charged creeper, not a regular one. Very nice to have just the classic versions of both.

The Build:

Simple build that was able to include the TNT exploding function. It was very interesting to see how they fit that into such a small model with so few pieces.

The Completed Model:

The scene itself could be added onto other Minecraft sets seamlessly, making it a perfect add-on kind of set. You could even buy a few more of these to make a long coastline. Plus, it has Steve and the Creeper to go with it and add on to the collectability or playability.

Overall Opinion:

This is probably my favorite LEGO polybag ever. A nice Minecraft scene even with a built in function, with Steve and a Creeper all in one. Probably the best $4 I've ever spent! I liked it so much that I bought a second copy just to keep sealed. I would totally recommend this set to any LEGO, Minecraft, or LEGO Minecraft fan. It's a small set, but it is a great value.

 

Edited for typos.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Minecraft Meets Polybags Round 1.
review:
Set #30393 Minecraft: Steve & Creeper Set: LEGO has been producing Minecraft inspired sets for a good few years now. This year marks the first release of a LEGO Minecraft Polybag. Which is a great idea and I’m amazed they did not try to include any sooner. Let’s go over the Pros and Cons and then discuss the final thoughts.

Pros:

  • Includes two Minifigures, Steve & a Creeper.
  • Model works as a great little set piece for the encounter between the two Minifigures.
  • Includes TNT Brick and explosive play feature.
  • Great value for your money.

Cons:

  • No unique printing on Minifigures.
  • Limited number of accessories for this set.
  • Sold out fast making it difficult to find at Retail.

Overall opinion

I love the idea behind this set. It adds more to your LEGO Minecraft collection and let’s you get the main character and an enemy for him to fight/defend against. You also get the printed TNT buildable element. Still this is a great parts pack for LEGO Minecraft fans, and I would strongly recommend trying to get multiples of it if you can to add more bricks to your Minecraft collection. I hope we get to see future Minecraft Polybags as the line continues.

Highly Recommended.

author: sirfangar
title: Quintessential
review:
Back when LEGO launched their minifigure-scale Minecraft sets nearing the end of 2014, I was beyond  excited, but ended up purchasing only the 21113 Cave. What I had wanted most out of the theme were the player-insert himself, Steve, and the Creeper.

It took nearly 5 years, but LEGO has at last provided us with an inexpensive way to get these 2 icons of the game. Though Steve is quite frequently seen throughout the line, albeit with slight variations, mostly armor add-ons and a rather diverse weapon selection, him and Creeper are enough to justify the price of a polybag. Licensed themes have had figures packaged the same way sell for 4-5 dollars, so this pack seems like a no-brainer.

The figurines are complimented with a rather spacious side build, all things considered. Alas, the play feature is nothing innovative, but does present a bit of action, showing that at least a modicum of thought was put into the scenery. I find this set to be the perfect entry point for anyone on the fence about the theme, surpassing last year's Melon Farm (much better value if you ask me).

You can't really go wrong with this one - the classic poster boys of the game alone are enough to attract attention of kids, teens and adults alike.

author: miuboy
title: unique minecraft polybag
review:
when i heard the news about this set, i was conflicted...

they created a minecraft Polybag! whats there not to love? then i saw it in person and instantly knew that this set is rather pitiful... 

COST

this set costed 3,99$ at my local Walmart, although i don't recommend this [unless you don't have a creeper] as i will expain in a moment...

PACKAGE

the standard Lego poly bag, although no complaints about it, other than it looking like a duplo bag

PARTS

this contains no useful parts, 

"BLOCKS" INCLUDED

there is several blocks that this set contains that can be easly acquired in other sets

TNT: boom is the only word to describe this...

POPPY: this is the depressing reminder of the rose...

TORCH: well, i have hundreds of these

MOBS: 

STEVE: prepare for another Steve, this time holding a stone sword

CREEPER: awe man... JK just your standard creeper, nothing special...

OVERALL REVIEW 

well, this set is unfortunatly upsetting... my brother bought this set, and to prove a point, i made this using existing pieces, and although this set is not BAD, it could of had a better potential, we could of had a cheap way to acquire a unique mob/skin, how about not adding Steve and adding a illiger, or how about a llama? we have had WAY too many of them...

in conclusion, i recommend only getting this if you need more creepers or... STEVES...., as this brings nothing unique to the table...

author: Nic1306
title: Minecraft in polybag version
review:
General infos about the set:

The set comes with two minfigs, Creeper and Steve. The set has 36 parts and got released in 2019 as first Minecraft polybag.

Minifigs:

The two minifigs coming in this set are Steve and a Creeper. None of the two are exclusive to this set, but its cool to see them in such a tiny set. It a cheap way to get the minifigs. Also the selection is very good. I think it makes sence, to include Steve in the first polybag.

The build:

The build includes nice parts but doesnt look so good. I think partet out, the parts are in better use. But the function with the TNT exploding is cool, and gives this set much and cool playability.

Overall:

Good worth for good minifigs and much playability and good parts, definitively worth to buy this one.
